author: Special Correspondent
text:
Set up at a cost of Rs. 6,376 crore, it is expected generate 19.2 million units of power per day

The foundation stone for the 800 MW Stage III of the North Chennai Thermal Power Station at Athipattu in Tiruvallur district was recently laid by Chief Minister Jayalalithaa.- Photo: DIPR

The foundation stone for the 800 MW Stage III of the North Chennai Thermal Power Station at Athipattu in Tiruvallur district was recently laid by Chief Minister Jayalalithaa.

The construction of the plant, which would be set up at a total cost of Rs. 6,376 crore, is expected to commence operation in August 2017 and generate 19.2 million units of power per day, according to an official release.

The Stage III would be spread over 250 acres in the same campus that houses Stage I and II of North Chennai Thermal Power Station.

The foundation stone was laid by Ms. Jayalalithaa through a video conference on Friday from the Secretariat.

She also handed over the agreement for Rs. 2,759 crore, towards designing, production, distribution, installation and executing after inspection of the plant to Bharat Heavy Electrials Limited (BHEL) Chairman and Managing Director Atul Sobti.

Electricity Minister Natham R. Viswanathan, Chief Secretary K. Gnanadesikan, advisor to the government Sheela Balakrishnan, Energy Secretary N.S. Palaniappan, Chairman and Managing Director of Tamil Nadu Generation and Distribution Corporation Limited (TANGEDCO) M. Saikumar, senior BHEL official G.K. Hedaoo were present on the occasion.
title: Foundation laid for 800 MW power plant
